channel.title: CVE Feed for Motorola -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Motorola -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-23771|2024-08-02T10:42:25.881Z -- motorola -- mbts%20base%20radio
item.description: Motorola MBTS Base Radio accepts hard-coded backdoor password. The Motorola MBTS Base Radio Man Machine Interface (MMI), allowing for service technicians to diagnose and configure the device, accepts a hard-coded backdoor password that cannot be changed or disabled.

item.title: CVE-2023-23774|2024-08-02T10:42:25.878Z -- motorola -- ebts%2Fmbts%20base%20radio
item.description: Motorola EBTS/MBTS Site Controller drops to debug prompt on unhandled exception. The Motorola MBTS Site Controller exposes a debug prompt on the device's serial port in case of an unhandled exception. This allows an attacker with physical access that is able to trigger such an exception to extract secret key material and/or gain arbitrary code execution on the device.

item.title: CVE-2023-23770|2024-08-02T10:42:26.206Z -- motorola -- mbts%20site%20controller
item.description: Motorola MBTS Site Controller accepts hard-coded backdoor password. The Motorola MBTS Site Controller Man Machine Interface (MMI), allowing for service technicians to diagnose and configure the device, accepts a hard-coded backdoor password that cannot be changed or disabled.

item.title: CVE-2023-23773|2024-08-02T10:42:25.883Z -- motorola -- ebts%2Fmbts%20base%20radio
item.description: Motorola EBTS/MBTS Base Radio fails to check firmware authenticity. The Motorola MBTS Base Radio lacks cryptographic signature validation for firmware update packages, allowing an authenticated attacker to gain arbitrary code execution, extract secret key material, and/or leave a persistent implant on the device.

item.title: CVE-2023-23772|2024-08-02T10:42:25.933Z -- motorola -- mbts%20site%20controller
item.description: Motorola MBTS Site Controller fails to check firmware update authenticity. The Motorola MBTS Site Controller lacks cryptographic signature validation for firmware update packages, allowing an authenticated attacker to gain arbitrary code execution, extract secret key material, and/or leave a persistent implant on the device.

item.title: CVE-2024-3109|2024-08-01T19:32:42.671Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: A hard-coded AES key vulnerability was reported in the Motorola GuideMe application, along with a lack of URI sanitation, could allow for a local attacker to read arbitrary files.

item.title: CVE-2024-3108|2024-08-01T19:32:42.745Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An implicit intent vulnerability was reported for Motorola’s Time Weather Widget application that could allow a local application to acquire the location of the device without authorization.

item.title: CVE-2022-4003|2024-07-31T21:02:13.515Z -- motorola -- q14%20mesh%20router%20firmware
item.description: A denial-of-service vulnerability could allow an authenticated user to trigger an internal service restart via a specially crafted API request.

item.title: CVE-2023-41823|2024-06-04T17:21:57.837Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An improper export vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Phone Extension application, that could allow a local attacker to execute unauthorized Activities.

item.title: CVE-2023-41819|2024-05-03T14:04:05.479Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: A PendingIntent hijacking vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Face Unlock application that could allow a local attacker to access unauthorized content providers.

item.title: CVE-2023-41818|2024-06-04T17:21:56.592Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An improper use of the SD card for sensitive data vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Device Help application that could allow a local attacker to read system logs.

item.title: CVE-2023-41822|2024-06-04T17:21:55.338Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An improper export vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Interface Test Tool application that could allow a malicious local application to execute OS commands.

item.title: CVE-2023-41825|2024-05-03T14:06:13.480Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: A path traversal vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Ready For application that could allow a local attacker to access local files.

item.title: CVE-2023-41829|2024-06-04T17:21:48.136Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An improper export vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Carrier Services application that could allow a malicious, local application to read files without authorization.

item.title: CVE-2023-41828|2024-06-04T17:21:45.667Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An implicit intent export vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Phone application, that could allow unauthorized access to a non-exported content provider.

item.title: CVE-2023-41824|2024-06-04T17:21:42.595Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An implicit intent vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Phone Calls application that could allow a local attacker to read the calling phone number and calling data.

item.title: CVE-2023-41827|2024-03-04T21:44:58.075Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An improper export vulnerability was reported in the Motorola OTA update application, that could allow a malicious, local application to inject an HTML-based message on screen UI.

item.title: CVE-2023-41830|2024-05-03T14:06:45.335Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An improper absolute path traversal vulnerability was reported for the Ready For application allowing a local application access to files without authorization.

item.title: CVE-2023-41826|2024-06-04T17:21:35.788Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: A PendingIntent hijacking vulnerability in Motorola Device Help (Genie) application that could allow local attackers to access files or interact with non-exported software components without permission.

item.title: CVE-2023-41817|2024-05-03T14:03:45.713Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An improper export vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Phone Calls application that could allow a local attacker to read unauthorized information.

item.title: CVE-2023-41821|2024-05-03T14:04:39.799Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: A an improper export vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Setup application that could allow a local attacker to read sensitive user information.

item.title: CVE-2023-41820|2024-05-03T14:04:16.223Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An implicit intent vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Ready For application that could allow a local attacker to read information about connected Bluetooth audio devices.

item.title: CVE-2023-41816|2024-06-04T17:21:29.771Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An improper export vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Services Main application that could allow a local attacker to write to a local database.

item.title: CVE-2024-3479|2024-05-03T14:10:07.470Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An improper export vulnerability was reported in the Motorola Enterprise MotoDpms Provider (com.motorola.server.enterprise.MotoDpmsProvider) that could allow a local attacker to read local data.

item.title: CVE-2024-3480|2024-05-03T14:10:15.549Z -- motorola -- phones
item.description: An Implicit intent vulnerability was reported in the Motorola framework that could allow an attacker to read telephony-related data.

item.description: A hard-coded AES key vulnerability was reported in the Motorola GuideMe application, along with a lack of URI sanitation, could allow for a local attacker to read arbitrary files.

item.description: An Implicit intent vulnerability was reported in the Motorola framework that could allow an attacker to read telephony-related data.
